description: A mix of bars, dance clubs and sports venues.

reviews.title: Enjoy sunset at Polson Pier
text: Polson pier has a great view of the Toronto skyline and possibility of a great sunset behind the Toronto buildings. I drove from Mississauga (around 25 mins) on a weekday and it was relatively empty. There's parking just before the park/nightclub and it was relatively empty around 8 when I reached. I was there till 10:30 pm and it was pretty crowded by the time I left. So it would be advisable to reach early if you want to relish the sunset.

There were few people with their camera/tripods and a separate couple photshoot was going on. Few people were just to enjoying the view and some groups were waiting for the nightclub to open. I don't see any security issue with many people around. Again, try to get in early to avoid parking issues.

reviews.title: Perfect photos, hidden gem
text: Find this place, you will get the perfect photo shot. this is what you see in the brochure, but you have to know your way round I think. We were on a coach tour so did not even know this is where we were going.
Perfect skyline pictures and I imagine the night time pictures would be even better.
The skyline view with the CNTower are iconic.
Loved it

reviews.title: Interesting use of industrial space but nothing really stands out
text: Interesting use of industrial space but nothing really stands out. Golf Driving range, Go karts, drive in theatre, all just average. The Cabana pool bar is cool if you're a hot twenty-something year old but again just average IMHO. There's WAY better in Miami or just about any other urban center.

reviews.title: Great for Skyline views
text: We caught the public bus and walked down to Polson Pier for night pictures of the city.
It was a stunning look-out although very cold in the winter!
Felt very safe in the area, hardly anyone about.
Well worth a visit it’s free and only takes 20 minutes from the City.

reviews.title: Horrific
text: If I could give zero stars, I would. This place is utterly tragic. Picture Jersey Shore and a duck lipped selfie manifested as a bar. This place is a sad statement on the world.
Clueless staff prancing around in bikinis spending more time on their phones than doing anything else. Outrageous prices. Not a single good thing to say. I couldn't leave fast enough.
They confiscated my aerosol sun screen at the door. Think about that for a second. The place is a beach bar, and they took away my brand new, unopened bottle of sunscreen. Nuff said.

reviews.title: Cabana pool bar: DANGEROUS ENVIRONMENT STAY AWAY!
text: I really, really wish i could give zero, even negative stars.

Me and my girlfriend went to Cabana to for the first time to see one of our favourite dj's of all time. It should have been one of the greatest days of our lives. Instead, while standing by a table (the entire club is surrounded by tables so this situation was inevitable), some fellow came up to me and my girlfriend and threatened to smash us in the head with a bottle for standing too close to they're table. I am 22 and my girlfriend is 20 and this guy was clearly over 30 years old. Four guys surrounded me and my girlfriend shouting and threatening us with violence till we left. Not a single staff member or customer said or did a single thing. After this I told not one, not two, THREE bouncers of the incident which just took place and not a single one even approached the table, let alone kick them out. The bouncers clearly have no concern for the well being of the customers. I asked a bartender to speak to a manager, after asking twice and waiting 30 minutes no manager never arrived. It became clearer at this point that customer service means absolutely nothing to this establishment.

My girlfriend and I left the bar after only being there for an hour and half and not even seeing the dj we wanted to see out of concern for our safety and well being. I paid 40$ dollars to be get in, and wasted over an hour and $30 dollars in travelling fees only to be threaten and mistreated until our departure. I wouldn't even recommend this establishment to my enemies, let alone ever return here myself. If you enjoy bars that prioritize profits over safety and customer satisfaction, than Cabana is the place for you!

reviews.title: Cabana Pool Bar
text: The service here was appalling! We came in at opening time and they were very disorganized at the bar! Regardless of the fact that they open at 12 PM, I don't understand why staff aren't trained to prepare prior to when people arrive. The bar informed us that they could not give us any drinks such as mojito's or pina colada's, so we settled for the rum and coke. And to top things off, it took 2 and a half hours to get a food order! An hour and a half to try to track down someone who would take my food order. I went up to almost everyone I saw who kept redirecting me to other people. Finally, when someone took my order, I had to wait another hour just to get my wrap which was stale and very disappointing. Even though they had nice facilities, the horrible service and unfriendly attitude of the staff is enough to turn me off from ever going back. I would not recommend this place to anyone.

reviews.title: Cabana Pool Bar
text: Visited this outdoor bar on Polson Pier. My first interaction with the security convinced me that they were there purely to harass you. For the entrance fee (around $20), you get access to the bar area, but not the pool (you have to pay extra for this). The scantily clad stewardesses are aloof and unhelpful, and are largely there to smile and make as much in tips as they can. However, if you like looking at scantily clad girls, then this is a good place to visit. Drinks range from around $8 to $10 for a beer, and more for mixed drinks. The pool itself was chilly (even for mid-summer).

reviews.title: Fantastic Venue
text: We attended the Flight Centre gala event last Friday, what an amazing venue, great service and food to boot.....Love the location, sleek and trendy and the best outdoor patio in the city.

reviews.title: Very cool spot to see the city
text: Went for a photo op, neat spot to get a photo with the city in the background. Otherwise not a whole lot worth a spending a lot of time for.

reviews.title: Don't go if you are self-conscious about your looks
text: It was full of people that only want to flaunt their bodies and wealth. In order to sit you need to order bottle service and the cheapest thing is Ketel One vodka for $220.00. Both staff and guests are very rude unless you look good and are spending your money. The view (of the city) is amazing though.

reviews.title: Not quite what we expected..
text: The pool was very murky and small. You also have to pay additional $20 to enter the pool section. There is no where available to sit without being forced to order food. Ladies washroom was very dirty as well sitting area. I wont be eager to come back.

reviews.title: Still awesome
text: Came back almost one year later.  Still great.  Staff will treat your kids like gold.  Seriously... Great customer service, esp for the little ones.  Get the Groupon for buy one get one free.  What a great place!

reviews.title: Drive-in theatre so worth it
text: Been here many times during the summer over the years and we always return! There are special nights where they have 3 movies - extra movie night. Concession stand was somewhat expensive for the food & drink so I suggest you bring your own drinks & snacks.

reviews.title: Drive-in theater fun
text: Very casual place. Fun thing to do. Sunday is $25.00 carload day. Food at concession stand was good and very reasonably priced. Popcorn tasted like it had REAL BUTTER on it! Best bet is to get there early, bring a boom-box and chairs (or they'll lend you some) and sit outside your car. You'll hear movie over radio turned to a local FM station. We're a bit spoiled with the Delsea Drive-in in NJ so Screen #2 is a bit on the small side for us, but still a fun and different way to see a movie especially with kids.

reviews.title: Washrooms are terrible
text: We went here for the Microsoft Party and found it to be shabby and run down, very poor facilities and the toilets had to be the worst I have seen anywhere in the world

reviews.title: HORRIBLY MANAGED
text: Way overpriced for everything.  Mini putt is in awful disrepair.  Rental clubs are mostly dented and bent.  The washrooms are filthy and stink.  The drive-in movie theater is not good because the movies are too dark.  The manager is an angry man who seems ill prepared to do his job.

reviews.title: Poor Customer Service
text: I phoned The Docks to see what time one of their attractions closed. Twice on the phone their customer service reps told me it was open, so naturally I drove down. Twenty minutes later when I got there it was definitely closed and always had been closed. Unfortunately they were not that friendly either or could answer why they said it was open.
I wrote to The Docks manager to bring this lack of knowledge and customer service to his attention. Unfortunately he hasn't even acknowledged the complaint.
This can only tell me they are not interested in customers. It's pity there isn't more competition for them to force them to improve.

reviews.title: Nice view, kind of run down
text: I came here on a fluke to see if anything had opened in this spot yet, and to my surprise it was the Cabana pool bar I kept hearing about. It was just myself and another girl, and we came during the week.
Entry is free except for Fridays, Saturday and Sundays (cover is $20). If you wish to use the pool it is an additional $20, and during the week it is only $15 to enter the pool area.

Let me say that if you complain this place is expensive, perhaps you shouldn't try dining on the waterfront in Toronto at a trendy place? The drinks were $7.50 for a rum and coke, and it was $8 for an edamame appetizer (normally less than $5 elsewhere, it's just a plate of salted beans, but gives you an idea of why so many reviews are complaining about the price range). I noted that one of their shrimp appetizers was listed at $48, and for bottle service on the weekends it starts at $220 for their cheapest bottle. This is supposed to be a trendy, resort-style, high-end place, located on the waterfront, hence the high price range.

Parking is ten dollars during the week and they stay open fairly late, depending on the amount of people there. The view over the water is amazing, you sit overlooking the skyline of Toronto and a perfect view of the CN tower across the water. All the staff wore white and were good looking, smiling people. During the week you can sit anywhere you want if it's not too crowded.
The cons of my visit were:

Pool tables were dirty and no longer trendily white. The felt was scratched up and the tables were all slanted! We'd take a shot and the cue ball would stop moving, then continue to move in an opposite direction. Most cues were broken or tip-less and the balls had pockmarks in them.

The white cushion covers and couch covers, durable resort style, were stained and dirty in most spots. Let's just say to be safe, I didn't let my bare legs touch any of the couches. If this place is going to be located where it is and claim to be upscale, then at least throw those cushion covers in the wash once a week? They have zippers on them for that reason.
All the white decor is wearing down, it's starting to look pretty faded combined with the dirty cushions.
On a nice day it gets really hot on this patio! Keep hydrated and stay cool in the pool(which is only 4ft deep and quite small).
This isn't against the venue, but regarding the crowd:

Each table was super content and happy, or looked utterly miserable. I noted at least three couples sitting at tables or walking by, all of them looking angry or upset. Also, a group of nearby girls were staring at me, so I smiled at them and they didn't smile back. It was too nice a day out for such catty behaviour!
Luckily, everyone else was really friendly and smiling. We chatted with some of the staff and a few other customers, and everyone was so relaxed and happy in the weather with the nice view.

Ladies, quick tip- Don't wear spiked or thinner heels- they will get caught in the cracks along the dock around the back to the patio, it's not a complaint against them it's just an issue that I've had attending various events at this location for years.

I'd return for the view but they need serious cleaning/updating of their surroundings and the equipment, especially since they are meant to be an upscale, palm tree filled paradise with all-white decor, and they charge as such for the experience.

reviews.title: Definitely Overpriced, But Different
text: The Good:
- if sitting by the pool isn't your thing, there are two foosball tables and two ping pong tables.
- staff and people here are all beautiful
- lovely view of Toronto and the CN tower
- different from what I am used to seeing. Worth a shot if you're the clubbing type.
The Bad:
- $20 cover and $20 to access the pool area. Drinks are a bit pricey.
- Kind of pretentious, superficial people here

reviews.title: Location, Location, Location
text: We went for a corporate event and had our own cabana.  It was a weeknight so it wasn't packed. From what I hear it's jammed on the weekends - especially Sunday afternoons.  Beautiful Location, Beautiful People, Wannabe Models, Great Music.  Very pricey drinks.  We ordered Mojitos and were asked if we wanted doubles.  It didn't even taste like a single - very weak and watered down.  We had a buffet for our group.  The appetizers that were served before dinner were very good, however dinner was just okay.  The only reason I gave it a 'very good' rating was because of the ambience and location.  If I were to rate it on the food and drinks only, it would be so-so at best.

reviews.title: Great Place!
text: I loved it at Cabana. The atmosphere was amazing, the music was really good. The food was to die for! We sat on the lounge chairs by the pool and it was just stunning. The view was amazing as well. Great staff. Really don't have anything bad to say about this place!

reviews.title: Save ur $$$, not worth the money or the hassel.
text: Save ur $$$, not worth the money or the hassel. Forced to order food if u sit. Went on the 21st of june, esthetically beautiful, it was 2 pm not a whole lot of ppl but we just came to have a few drinks in a relaxed spot. Lots of empty couches. Waitress came by said that at these tables if we ordered drink n food, even an appetizer we would be ok to sit. After ordering a $40 pitcher of sangria and fries we decided to sit right next to the tables, on couches. To our delight, we were forced to order from the entree menu. After being harassed by big bad manager Helen who came numerous times with the first 7 min followed by a male waiter to intimidate. We left after finishing our pitcher. Not
impressed with the treatment. Hope no one has to experience such an awful day like this one. Especially when u came out to chill and relax.

reviews.title: Nice but a flashy scene
text: The place is live and vibrant but lacks class. The crowd is obsessed with showing off. It gives you a bad feeling. The staff is a bit obnoxious as well. Too bad as this place has tons of potential

reviews.title: Best place on a Sunday
text: This is the place to be on a sunny Sunday afternoon in the summer. Literally thousands of people show up there to listen to good music and catch the sun. Also it is not out of the normal for big name DJ's such as Deadmau5 and Adventure Club (to name a few) to show up and play a quick surprise set for a big crowd.

reviews.title: Beautiful, but overpriced
text: We wanted to come in with our friend for a while, and finally made it all together in August (10 people). Everything looked beautiful, white and clean. The only concern I had is that we had to pay $20 to come in and $20 to get to the pool which is really small + $10 downpayment for a towel. It is beautiful, don't get me wrong, but $40 to come in and have no place to sit?
Cabana costed us $1400 on a top of cover fee. So, if you feel comfortable paying $200 per person for a pool party, then you should go.
I don't regret coming. It was fun, but I don't feel that it was the best spent $400 for my husband and I.

reviews.title: Cabana is EPIC worth every penny!
text: Cabana poolbar in Toronto is epic, I had a blast here. Cabana is best on Sunday though.
The food was out of this world (we tried sushi, pizza, nachos, fries, potato wedges, bruchetta)
Also, the girls at this place were gorgeous. The crowd is very upscale and a must-see.
check my video http://www.reformatt.com/blog/cabana-toronto

reviews.title: Nikki Beach of Toronto!
text: The Cabana pool bar is gorgeous with great atmosphere and view. We went on a weekday afternoon and was surprised to see that most of the lounge chairs were full. The pool area is just large enough and the music was great. The cabanas were off limits unless you have bottle service but we were fine chilling on lounge chairs by the pool. The view of downtown Toronto was gorgeous. Washroom is a shared facility and is like a public washroom but at least there was a washroom attendant. Parking was $10 and there was no sign to the Cabana pool bar...you have to walk around the building to find the unmarked Terrance with a bouncer. I would come back on a weekday but I can imagine how packed it would be on a weekend. Toronto needs more spaces like this!

reviews.title: Movie quality and sounds awful, staff rude, food nasty, don't waste your time or money.
text: Just came back from there. Sound quality was awful, we couldn't see the screen from the car the resolution was so bad, and when we asked for a refund we were told "to bad." Save your money. You will ruin the movie, as you car hardly make out the images.
Security guards also walk around checking people's tickets wish flashlights which gets really annoying. It is not an enjoyable experience.

reviews.title: City skyline
text: Offers great view of the city if you have no time. You can see Toronto skyline with all its skyscrapers

reviews.title: Caribana Cool Down Fete
text: The ambience is simply amazing and the set up of the Cabana is real nice... Vegas style...
The food from the kitchen is also great...

reviews.title: Need to visit Cabana Pool Bar
text: There is a pool bar that is a must to visit at the Polson Pier. Amazing atmosphere, food and drinks. This place always has famous DJ's,and is popular among celebrities. During the week it's more relaxing, but on the weekends watch out. You feel like your at a Vegas Pool Party.

reviews.title: Fun ...but poor customer service
text: This place has great potential. its nice to have something like this in toronto.... The first time i came here was when it first opened and it was a good experience. i came back a year later and the customer service sucks!! staff is stuck up and rude.

my friends needed a locker and we put 2$ in change and when the locker didn't work we advise the staff at the tuck shop..the staff advised that she cant give us a tonnie that we shud have read the instructions. so we basically had to put more money in...its not about the 2$ but the simple courtesy and customer service....she was rude in stating that we shud have read the instructions ( which we shud have  the  but didnt as we were caught up in the moment,but as a person in customer service she shud have done something instead of being rude about it)
POOR SERVICE!STUCK UP AND RUDE STAFF!
This place is also full of strippers.

reviews.title: Searching for the RIGHT Skyline shot!
text: I searched high and low for the perfect view to get a nightime shot of the Skyline and bingo!
Polson pier was the perfect spot!  its a dead end street at the end of Polson street and the dead end is a small pier.
Other tourists were in and out of this dead end as well, and the view was breathtaking at night!  I got a couple of good shots in!

reviews.title: TERRIBLE STAY AWAY
text: I bought a wristband for 2 days of admission to this place a Sunday and a Saturday for the following week. Sunday got cancelled because of weather they wouldn't give me back my money because it was for two days and so they said I can attend both Saturday and Sunday following week.

Attented Saturday and got it which was a mistake since this place is for rich jerks. No table No chairs unless you want to spend over $1000 for reservations. I was surprised they didn't have a cap for the amount of oxygen you can inhale! Anyways right in the middle of crowd saw drunk jerks walking around and witnessed a couple of sexual harrassments and none of staff even bothered to follow up.

When i was taking the wrist band off of the card i noticed it was weitten small where the band is attached to the card so theres no way you can notice it unless you take it off: attend before 3 pm so since there's nothing about it on yhe card i didnt care on Saturday i happened to be there at 2 but next day got there exactly 3:20 so the bouncer didn't let me in and asked for me to pay full admission which was lower than what i originally paid.

Customer service sucks, staff have no clue about customer service  and I ended up over paying because the original event that got cancelled was more expensive. Overall i wouldn't recommend this place to anyone even if it's FREE admission.

reviews.title: LOVE THIS PLACE!!!!
text: I love Cabana Pool Bar!! It's the best spot on nice summers day.. Beautiful music,beautiful people and amazing scenery!!! Just a heads up they are tight with dress code (not complaining) and bring money! Between the cover and parking and drinks!! But the end of they day it is a great place to go!!

reviews.title: Offers great view of the city if you have no time for ferry
text: it's a short walk from the distillery district. If you are in Toronto only for a short time and still wants to see the city's gorgeous skyline, then Polson Pier is a great place for you to check out. If you happen to arrive in Toronto by ferry, it's not far from the ferry terminal.

reviews.title: Best place to spend summer days in TO
text: Cabana Pool bar is a great place to spend a warm day right in the city. Lots of great music, drinks, events, DJs, people, and more. Absolutely love spending long days in the sun and nights under the stars partying with friends at Cabana!
